page.title: 02RELIGION - OWERSBY CHURCH
page.content: St.Martins Church North Owersby stands on the highest point in the village surrounded by the churchyard which is still in use though very full.The gravestones on the south side were re- moved to the edge of the churchyard 2yrs.ago to help mowing and allow tree planting.Communion services(ASB Rite B) are held on the 2nd and 4th Sundays in the month with a regular congregat- ion of 12/15.Services are also held on special occasions e.g.Mothering Sunday when the Sunday School children take part.Members of the congregation take turns to read the lessons,the organist plays the 2 manual pedal organ and 1 of the 2 bells is rung before services Heating in winter is by calorgas fires and electric fan heaters.6 of the 12 coloured glass windows have been removed,repaired and replaced this year at a cost of Â£1,200.
